title: Configuration Interfaces Documentation
description: This documentation page describes various configuration interfaces used in the application, detailing their properties and usage.
author: Documentation Team

blocks.content: This documentation provides an overview of the various configuration interfaces used in the application, including their properties and how to utilize them effectively.
The following interfaces are defined for managing configuration settings within the application.
The NavItem interface represents a navigation item with properties for the display label, URL, and an optional flag to show or hide the item.
The SocialLink interface defines the structure for social media links, including the platform name, URL, and associated icon.
The Logo interface specifies the properties for logo configuration, including the image path, dimensions, and an optional display flag.
These interfaces do not have configurable options; they are intended to be used as data structures for managing application settings.
When using these interfaces, ensure that all required properties are provided to avoid runtime errors.
